pkgmetadata.longdescription: Django Azure AD Auth======================*Django Azure AD Auth* allows you to authenticate through Azure Active Directory.Installation------------Run `pip install django-azure-ad-auth`Add the `AzureActiveDirectoryBackend` to your `AUTHENTICATION_BACKENDS` setting:```pythonAUTHENTICATION_BACKENDS = ( ... 'azure_ad_auth.backends.AzureActiveDirectoryBackend',)```Settings--------###AAD_TENANT_IDThe Azure Tenant ID. It can be found in the URL of the Azure Management Portal.###AAD_CLIENT_IDThe Azure Application Client ID.###AAD_AUTHORITY**default:** `'https://login.microsoftonline.com'`The domain that is used for authorization, the federation metadata document, and loggin out.###AAD_SCOPE**default:** `'openid'`OAuth scope parameter.###AAD_RESPONSE_TYPE**default:** `'id_token'`Tells OAuth to return a JWT token in its response.###AAD_RESPONSE_MODE**default:** `'form_post'`Defines how the response parameters are returned. Valid choices are `fragment` or `form_post`.###AAD_USER_CREATION**default:** `True`Allow creation of new users after successful authentication.
